subject: Learning
title: Vygotsky's Zone of Proximal Development
description: A micro-lesson that makes Vygotsky's Zone of Proximal Development usable.

hook.text: A child can't tie their shoes alone but can do it with a parent guiding their hands. That gap is where learning lives.

buildup.text: Vygotsky's zone of proximal development (ZPD) is the gap between what a child can do alone and with help.

discovery.text: Learning happens most effectively within the ZPDâ€”tasks that are challenging but achievable with scaffolding.

twist.text: Tasks below the ZPD bore children. Tasks above it frustrate them. The zone is where growth happens.

climax.text: Good teaching means constantly adjusting supportâ€”providing scaffolding, then gradually removing it as skill grows.

punchline.text: Teach in the zone: hard enough to stretch, supported enough to succeed.

quiz.question: What is the zone of proximal development?
options: The gap between what a child can do alone and what they can do with help
The area of the brain responsible for learning
The age range when children learn most quickly
